Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Legendary \Leg"end*a*ry\ (l[e^]j"[e^]n*d[asl]*r[y^]), a. Of or pertaining to a legend or to legends; consisting of legends; like a legend; fabulous. ``Legendary writers.'' --Bp. Lloyd. [1913 Webster]
Legendary stories of nurses and old women. --Bourne. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Legendary \Leg"end*a*ry\, n. [Cf. OF. legendaire, LL. legendarius.] 1. A book of legends; a tale or narrative. [1913 Webster]
Read the Countess of Pembroke's ``Arcadia,'' a gallant legendary full of pleasurable accidents. --James I. [1913 Webster]
2. One who relates legends. --Bp. Lavington. [1913 Webster]

legendary adj 1: so celebrated as to having taken on the nature of a legend; "the legendary exploits of the arctic trailblazers" 2: celebrated in fable or legend; "the fabled Paul Bunyan and his blue ox"; "legendary exploits of Jesse James" [syn: {fabled}]
